meanings.definition: the act of feeling or expressing sorrow or grief
meanings.sent1: During the mourning, she cried softly in her room.
meanings.sent2: The whole town came together in mourning after the tragic accident.
meanings.sent3: At the funeral, there was so much mourning that even the sky seemed to weep.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a garden of mourning flowers, each petal a memory of loss.
meanings.sent5: The sound of mourning echoed through the empty halls, a haunting melody of sadness.

meanings.definition: the period of time during which one grieves a death
meanings.sent1: The mourning lasted for weeks, each day heavier than the last.
meanings.sent2: In traditional cultures, mourning customs vary widely.
meanings.sent3: During the mourning, he found solace in the memories of his loved one.
meanings.sent4: The mourning felt like a never-ending tunnel of darkness, with no light in sight.
meanings.sent5: The mourning period was a time of reflection and remembrance for all who knew her.

meanings.definition: wearing black clothes as a sign of mourning
meanings.sent1: She wore a mourning dress to the somber ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The family members were all dressed in mourning attire.
meanings.sent3: Despite the mourning clothes, there was a sense of unity and support among the group.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds above seemed to match the mourning garments of the attendees.
meanings.sent5: The mourning attire added a somber tone to the already melancholy event.
